A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Not the film the trailers painted it out to be\, Disney and Lucasfilm clearly knew that what they had created was not what the fans wanted otherwise they would have shown a completely different trailer.  

Luke is not Luke\, even Mark Hamill said as much\, his first moment on screen is a huge wtf moment followed by many more. I'm actually disgusted at the sheer contempt shown to him in this film. 

The plot is threadbare at best\, Rey is magically able to do everything without the slightest bit of training. If she were a character in any other film they would pick on that instantly. 

They once again waste Gwendoline Christie\, Phasma should be a terrifying presence but is reduced to two minutes of chunky dialogue and a short and wasted fight scene.

Admiral Holdo is reduced to looking sternly at Poe and then killed off. I would have loved to see more of Phasma and Holdo and learned more about them\, but I guess having them in a film for five minutes and then killed off because reasons ticks the 'strong female characters' box you want the critics to look for.  

Don't even get me started on the pointless Finn and Rose plot line which could have all been avoided if Holdo had just told Poe the plan in the first place. What a waste of Benicio Del Toro!

Mary Poppins Leia? Really? 

Lazy writing\, lazy plot\, terrible treatment of the franchise.

Totally heartbroken at the treatment of a franchise I have followed and loved since childhood. Yet I guess that makes me a sexist racist too right? Because apparently that's what you are if you don't like this film.
